001package ca.gc.cra.radar.api;
002
003import java.util.ArrayList;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
006import java.util.List;
007import java.util.Locale;
008import java.util.Set;
009
010/**
011 * Parsed representation of CLI arguments split into flags and key/value pairs.
012 */
013public final class CliInput {
014  private static final Set<String> HELP_FLAGS = Set.of("--help", "-h", "help");
015  private static final Set<String> VERBOSE_FLAGS = Set.of("--verbose", "-v", "--debug");
016
017  private final String[] keyValueArgs;
018  private final Set<String> flags;
019  private final boolean help;
020  private final boolean verbose;
021
022  private CliInput(String[] keyValueArgs, Set<String> flags, boolean help, boolean verbose) {
023    this.keyValueArgs = keyValueArgs;
024    this.flags = flags;
025    this.help = help;
026    this.verbose = verbose;
027  }
028
029  /**
030   * Parses raw arguments into flag and key/value partitions.
031   *
032   * @param args raw CLI arguments (may be {@code null})
033   * @return parsed representation of the arguments
034   */
035  public static CliInput parse(String[] args) {
036    if (args == null || args.length == 0) {
037      return new CliInput(new String[0], Set.of(), false, false);
038    }
039
040    List<String> kv = new ArrayList<>();
041    Set<String> flags = new LinkedHashSet<>();
042    boolean help = false;
043    boolean verbose = false;
044    for (String raw : args) {
045      if (raw == null) {
046        continue;
047      }
048      String arg = raw.trim();
049      if (arg.isEmpty()) {
050        continue;
051      }
052      String lower = arg.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
053      if (HELP_FLAGS.contains(lower)) {
054        help = true;
055        flags.add("--help");
056        continue;
057      }
058      if (VERBOSE_FLAGS.contains(lower)) {
059        verbose = true;
060        flags.add("--verbose");
061        continue;
062      }
063      if ((arg.startsWith("--") || arg.startsWith("-")) && !arg.contains("=")) {
064        flags.add(lower);
065        continue;
066      }
067      kv.add(arg);
068    }
069    return new CliInput(kv.toArray(String[]::new), Set.copyOf(flags), help, verbose);
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Returns a defensive copy of the key/value style arguments.
074   *
075   * @return copy of arguments intended for key=value parsing
076   */
077  public String[] keyValueArgs() {
078    return Arrays.copyOf(keyValueArgs, keyValueArgs.length);
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Indicates whether a help flag was supplied.
083   *
084   * @return {@code true} if help output was requested
085   */
086  public boolean help() {
087    return help;
088  }
089
090  /**
091   * Indicates whether verbose logging was requested.
092   *
093   * @return {@code true} when --verbose (or equivalent) was present
094   */
095  public boolean verbose() {
096    return verbose;
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Checks whether a normalized flag such as {@code --dry-run} was provided.
101   *
102   * @param flag flag to query (case-insensitive)
103   * @return {@code true} if the flag was supplied
104   */
105  public boolean hasFlag(String flag) {
106    if (flag == null || flag.isBlank()) {
107      return false;
108    }
109    String normalized = flag.trim().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
110    return flags.contains(normalized);
111  }
112
113  /**
114   * Returns all normalized flags supplied on the command line.
115   *
116   * @return set of normalized flags (lowercase)
117   */
118  public Set<String> flags() {
119    return Set.copyOf(flags);
120  }
121}
